protocol_name: Preparation of Tara Sample DNA From Iron-Chloride Precipitates
protocol_name_html: Preparation of Tara Sample DNA From Iron-Chloride Precipitates

materials.reagent_name: Quant-iT dsDNA Pico Green assay kit (Invitrogen)

protocol_affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, The Ohio State University

authors_list.name: Matt Sullivan Lab
authors_list.affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, The Ohio State University

guidelines:
References to 'DNA Extraction of Viruses using Wizard Prep Columns' protocol

Needed:
  • Filters
  • Forceps (bleached)
  • Aluminum foil squares
  • 50cc tube
  • Resuspension buffer (0.1M EDTA - 0.2M MgCl2 - 0.2M Ascorbate Buffer)
  • Sterile applicator sticks
  • 20 mL filter
  • 2x 10mL filter
  • 20L seawater
  • Parafilm
  • Aluminum foil
  • Rotator
  • Rubber bands
  • 5mL pipet
  • 15mL or 50 mL sterile tube
  • Centrifuge @ 1000 rpm, 14rpm, 1,000g and 10,000g
  • Stock DNase
  • DNase buffer
  • EDTA
  • EGTA
  • Amicon Ultra 100kDa centrifugal concentrator
  • Wizard Prep Resin
  • Wizard Prep Column
  • 3mL Luer Lock Syringe
  • 5mL Snap-cap tube
  • Plunger
  • Syringe barrel
  • 80% Isopropanol
  • 1.5 mL centrifuge tube
  • 50-100 µL TE
  • Pico Green assay

components.data: Locate samples and record inventory number and number of filters (or portions) used
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Locate samples and record inventory number and number of filters (or portions) used

components.data: Turn the filters precipitate-side out with bleached forceps that have been rinsed with water and use aluminum foil squares as work surface, discarding after each filter
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Turn the filters precipitate-side out with bleached forceps that have been rinsed with water and use aluminum foil squares as work surface, discarding after each filter

components.data: Remove filter from 50cc tube and refold so that precipitate side comes in contact with resuspension buffer
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove filter from 50cc tube and refold so that precipitate side comes in contact with resuspension buffer

components.data: Return filter to tube using forceps and sterile applicator sticks
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Return filter to tube using forceps and sterile applicator sticks

components.data: Keep filters dark and refrigerated until ready to suspend
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Keep filters dark and refrigerated until ready to suspend

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 5 of Preparation of Tara Sample DNA From Iron-Chloride Precipitates
source_data.protocol_name: Preparation of Tara Sample DNA From Iron-Chloride Precipitates
source_data.protocol_name_html: Preparation of Tara Sample DNA From Iron-Chloride Precipitates
source_data.annotation: There should be moisture in the tube - do not let the filters dry out.  Usually when the filters are put into the tube initially, they carry some residual seawater with them that serves this purpose.  A milliliter of sterile molecular biology grade water can be added if necessary.
source_data.thread_text: There should be moisture in the tube - do not let the filters dry out.  Usually when the filters are put into the tube initially, they carry some residual seawater with them that serves this purpose.  A milliliter of sterile molecular biology grade water can be added if necessary.
source_data.body: There should be moisture in the tube - do not let the filters dry out.  Usually when the filters are put into the tube initially, they carry some residual seawater with them that serves this purpose.  A milliliter of sterile molecular biology grade water can be added if necessary.
source_data.affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, The Ohio State University

source_data.description: Prepare 1x or 2x resuspension buffer.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 6 of Preparation of Tara Sample DNA From Iron-Chloride Precipitates
source_data.protocol_name: Preparation of Tara Sample DNA From Iron-Chloride Precipitates
source_data.protocol_name_html: Preparation of Tara Sample DNA From Iron-Chloride Precipitates
source_data.annotation: Check that pH of buffer is pH 6.0-6.5
source_data.thread_text: Check that pH of buffer is pH 6.0-6.5
source_data.body: Check that pH of buffer is pH 6.0-6.5

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 6 of Preparation of Tara Sample DNA From Iron-Chloride Precipitates
source_data.protocol_name: Preparation of Tara Sample DNA From Iron-Chloride Precipitates
source_data.protocol_name_html: Preparation of Tara Sample DNA From Iron-Chloride Precipitates
source_data.annotation: Prepare about 20% more than needed
source_data.thread_text: Prepare about 20% more than needed
source_data.body: Prepare about 20% more than needed

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 6 of Preparation of Tara Sample DNA From Iron-Chloride Precipitates
source_data.protocol_name: Preparation of Tara Sample DNA From Iron-Chloride Precipitates
source_data.protocol_name_html: Preparation of Tara Sample DNA From Iron-Chloride Precipitates
source_data.annotation: See 0.1M EDTA - 0.2M MgCl2 - 0.2M Ascorbate Buffer
source_data.thread_text: See 0.1M EDTA - 0.2M MgCl2 - 0.2M Ascorbate Buffer
source_data.body: See 0.1M EDTA - 0.2M MgCl2 - 0.2M Ascorbate Buffer

components.data: Prepare 20mL 1x or 10mL 2x per filter from 20L of seawater
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare 20mL 1x or 10mL 2x per filter from 20L of seawater

components.data: Add resuspension buffer to each filter
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add resuspension buffer to each filter

components.data: Parafilm the tubes and wrap all of them in aluminum foil
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Parafilm the tubes and wrap all of them in aluminum foil

components.data: Put foil pack of tubes on rotator, in cold room, using rubber bands to secure, and rotate slowly overnight
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Put foil pack of tubes on rotator, in cold room, using rubber bands to secure, and rotate slowly overnight

components.data: To recover resuspended viruses, remove the liquid at the bottom using a 5mL pipet and transfer to a fresh 15mL or 50mL sterile, labeled tube
components.name: Description

source_data.description: To recover resuspended viruses, remove the liquid at the bottom using a 5mL pipet and transfer to a fresh 15mL or 50mL sterile, labeled tube

components.data: Using bleached and rinsed forceps or sterile applicator sticks, pull edge of filter up and over lip of tube and secure with the lid
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Using bleached and rinsed forceps or sterile applicator sticks, pull edge of filter up and over lip of tube and secure with the lid

components.data: Centrifuge 1000rpm, 5min, 18°C to recover liquid left on filter
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge 1000rpm, 5min, 18°C to recover liquid left on filter

components.data: Remove liquid and add more buffer if filter still has a lot of precipitate clinging to it
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove liquid and add more buffer if filter still has a lot of precipitate clinging to it
Rotate for several more hours
Repeat removal of liquid

components.data: Dilute stock DNase 1:100 in 10x DNase buffer (concentration = 400 U/mL)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dilute stock DNase 1:100 in 10x DNase buffer (concentration = 400 U/mL)
